text: Ayyaan haka’u jette biicheen
meaning: A person needs an opportunity to fulfill his wishes.
transliteration: ''Luck! Let it rise!” said the dwarf antelope.

text: Apantweaa se ɔbɛsom afanu a, momma ɔnsom; na animguaseɛ ba a, na ɔbɛhunu.
meaning: If someone thinks they can be on both sides in a quarrel, let them try and see the bad results.
transliteration: If the bat says it will serve two masters, let it do so; if disgrace comes, then it will know its position.

text: በወላጅነት ጉዞ ውስጥ፣ የተዋሃዱ ልቦች መንገዱን ይቀይሳሉ።
meaning: In the journey of parenthood, success comes from mutual support and cooperation between partners.
transliteration: In parenthood's voyage, united hearts chart the course.

text: Saatugo buutol haɗataa caarol
transliteration: The thickness of the pampers does not stop diarrhoea

text: Abin da wancan ya ce shi na ce! in ji matsoraci
meaning: A coward cannot repeat what he said
transliteration: What that person said is what I said is the slogan of a fearful person.

text: Ọ na-abụ agadi nwaanyị mara onye ọ ga-emeri, mgbe ahịa suru ọ buru ụzọ gaba n'ọdụ ahịa onye ahụ.
meaning: A coward always attacks the person weaker than himself at any least provocation.
transliteration: The only person an old woman can defeat is always her first target whenever there is break down of law and order in the market.

text: Ukukhala kuwumsebenzi ongakhiqizi.
meaning: This proverb suggests that instead of lamenting over a situation, it's better to take productive action to resolve it.
transliteration: Crying is an unproductive occupation

text: Umuryango munini ntubura umukobwa kuruha
meaning: Whatever your background, your problems are only yours.  It reminds people to take responsibility for their own issues without waiting for others to help
transliteration: The big family will not stop their daughter from miseries.

text: Mama wee! Niulaga nunda mla watu.
meaning: Used to build excitement and courage before embarking on a daunting task, portraying a fearless and adventurous spirit.
transliteration: Eh, mother! I'll kill that man-eating monster.

text: Ézonga na ngái ézonga.
meaning: A demand for restitution.
transliteration: Rends ce qui m'appartient, rends-le.

text: Mudzimu wakupa ronda wati nhunzi dzikudye.
meaning: This is when one problem leads to another.
transliteration: The ancestral spirit that inflicted wound on you has exposed you to being fed on by flies.

text: Ilmuhu maanta maqan; waayo, aduunka maanta maqan.
meaning: Be adaptable and continuously seek new knowledge.
transliteration: Tomorrow's knowledge is not today's knowledge; the world is ever-changing.

text: Ñax mu wow dina lakk gu tooy.
meaning: Bad company corrupts good character.
transliteration: Dry grass will burn wet grass.

text: Isikukukutya sityalwa ngumbala.
meaning: Even small or insignificant things can cause pain or distress.
transliteration: The hurt that causes you to cry is caused by a hair.

text: Owó yẹ ilé, Ògún yẹ odò.
meaning: Money is desirable thing in a home.
transliteration: Money fits a home quite well; Ogun is at home by the river.

text: midhuuf kan yaddee ni maraatecha.
meaning: Someone who wishes to cause harm will drive their target to distress.
transliteration: He drives mad those he intends to harm.

text: Ɔpanin pa yɛ na.
meaning: It is difficult to chance on people with a clean heart in recent times.
transliteration: A good elder is rare.

text: ልማድ ያሰርቃል ተዐመድ፡፡
meaning: Engaging in negative habits leads to ultimately worthless or futile outcomes.
transliteration: When your habit is bad, you'll end up stealing ashes.

text: Moye fuu maggii puccu suuno jippoto wuro semteende
meaning: Greed is a shameful act at any point
transliteration: Anybody who rides on a horse of greed will disembark in the home of shame

text: Ana gina sai ga bindi.
meaning: Encountering danger in the midst of feat scares you off
transliteration: They were digging, then comes tail.

text: Ụbọchị onye ori ga-akwa nne ya, ndị ihe ha furu agarube
meaning: People are recognised for what they are involved in.
transliteration: Any day a thief is celebrating his mother's funeral, people whose items are missing will attend.

text: Igundane lizishaya isifuba ngemvubu.
meaning: Pride often leads to foolishness.
transliteration: A mouse boasts of a hippopotamus.

text: Ubwenge bw’umwe buragora
meaning: It always takes more than one person to complete a complex task.
transliteration: Knowledge of one difficult.

text: Tokomile hatoi wali kumbini.
meaning: Every matter has its proper time.
transliteration: The tokomile dance is not played in initiation rites.

text: Wenda mpasi, toya ye mpebisi.
meaning: emphasizes the importance of nurturing and enhancing growth in relationships.
transliteration: Épouse un palmier, apprends à le fertiliser.

text: Tsuro haiponi rutsva kaviri.
meaning: After surviving a threat, one should not keep exposing themselves to the same threat.
transliteration: A hare does not escape a veld fire twice.

text: Guushaaga waa gawrac, xoolahaaga ma guurso.
meaning: Success is noticed by others, but failures are often kept private; maintain confidence even in challenging times.
transliteration: Your victory is witnessed, but your defeat is unseen.

text: . Ku jàngul du tari.
meaning: What you have not learnt you do not know well enough to be able to do.
transliteration: If you have not studied, you will not recite.

text: Ukufunda kuyandulela.
meaning: It implies that education adds value and depth to individuals' lives.
transliteration: Learning is enriching.

text: Ẹni tó ńtẹ aṣọ rẹ̀ mọ́lẹ̀, ó di dandan kó fa ti ẹlòmíràn ya
meaning: How people handle their affairs is an indication of how they would those of others
transliteration: Anyone who tramples on his clothes won't balk at tearing up those of others

text: Dubbiin sobaa dhagaa huba
meaning: Lies hurt even the strongest people.
transliteration: The word of a lie hurts like a stone.

text: Onyame amma wo ba a, mma no nyɛ wo ya, na ebia na ne papa mu a.
meaning: God knows best. /We should accept the conditions we have and not be bitter.
transliteration: If God doesn't give you a child, don't be unhappy, for it could be for a good reason.

text: የስኬት መንገድ ሁል ጊዜ በመገንባት ላይ ነው።
meaning: Embracing the ongoing journey of self-improvement and achievement.
transliteration: The road to success is always under construction.

text: Hunnduko taƴata daande
meaning: The action of one’s mouth can land a person into big trouble
transliteration: The mouth cuts the throat

text: Alkawari, cikin magana ne.
meaning: Promises are binding on those who made them
transliteration: A promise is part of a discussion

text: Ọ bụrụ na a na-eni ozu agadị, ọnwụ agụba onye ọgbọ ya.
meaning: Everything loses its attractiveness after some time even life itself.
transliteration: An old man would always desire to die whenever he watches his age mate being buried.

text: Inyama isithunzi sabantu.
meaning: Food and sustenance are essential to human life and well-being.
transliteration: Meat is the shadow of people.

text: Uguhiga ubutwari muratabarana
meaning: If someone doesn't believe you can do something you must show them you capabilities by doing great things.
transliteration: The one who hesitate your heroism you go to war together.

text: Msi chembe wala uta, si muwani.
meaning: Conveys that a person must have the appropriate equipment and skills to be considered skilled or proficient in a particular field.
transliteration: One who has neither an arrow nor a bow is not a warrior.

text: Monɔkɔ ezali na kati ya motema.
meaning: Words reflect what's in the heart. Les mots reflètent ce qui est dans le cœur.
transliteration: The mouth is at the heart. La bouche est au cœur.

text: Kunzi dzipakate handi kunzi dziridze.
meaning: One who has been entrusted with something cannot do with it as they please without the owner’s permission.
transliteration: When asked to carry them (drums), you were not asked to play them.

text: Ninkii caana ma laha, geed aan dharka lahayn ma jirto.
meaning: Encourages proactive efforts to secure one's future and well-being.
transliteration: One who does not plant will not have a shade.

text: Aduna teradi.
meaning: Life is rough and unpredictable.
transliteration: This world is a restless bedfellow.

text: Ukwenza okubi kumele wohlwaywe.
meaning: It emphasizes the importance of accountability and facing the consequences of one's actions.
transliteration: Doing wrong must have a consequence.

text: Orúkọ ẹni ní ńjẹ́rìí ẹni lókèèrè.
meaning: Your reputation determines what people who do not know you go by.
transliteration: One's name is one's most effective advocate abroad.

text: Tikseen / boo-a abbaa hinhaleelt
meaning: Grief and bad luck cannot be passed over to others
transliteration: A shepherd does not take over the lamentation of his master.

text: Onipa dɔ wo a, ɛnnim sɛ ɛbini wɔ wo ho
meaning: Love accepts and conquers all.
transliteration: If a person loves you, it wouldn't matter that there is excrement on your body.

text: የሚያሳዝን ፊት ይታያል ነገር ግን የሚያዝን ልብ አይደለም
meaning: Outward appearances may not fully reflect someone's inner emotions or feelings
transliteration: A sad face is noticeable but not a sad heart.

text: Ɓaaraaki beembal harnataa
meaning: You must work for a living
transliteration: Sitting by the side of corn bin cannot make one fill his stomach

text: Gara samun ƙarya da rashin gaskiya.
meaning:
the proverb signifies a word of encouragement by indicating thus, no matter what, try not to be poor. But this should not be misperceived as 
ideally promoting all means to gain advantage. It is better to try and earn your sweat even if you do it wrongly than to deceive and earn something that is not yours.
transliteration: Better to be a fancy rich than to stay real poor.

text: Éze taa ikikiri ézé, ohu ataa ogwu
meaning: Class and experiences determines individuals level of livelihood
transliteration: If a king chews his teeth, the servant will eat thorns

text: Amanxeba abuhlungu kakhulu.
meaning: The consequences of one's actions can be very painful.
transliteration: Wounds are very painful

text: Haba Rugira, hakaba umugezi
meaning: None can escape their challenges regardless of their faith
transliteration: There is God and there is a river

text: Hewala si utumwa.
meaning: Respect is not bought.
transliteration: That's right is not the same as slavery.

text: Mpe bakambi bamemaki biso kuna.
meaning: Friends' advice should be valued and followed.
transliteration: And the leaders took us there.

text: Rombe nderichaenda, radzoka ndimambo.
meaning: One who shows initiative is often ridiculed, but if they succeed they are praised.
transliteration: A beggar is the one going away, one who returning is a chief.

text: Ninka xanuun baa u socda, ee nin kale waa isoo xanuunsaday.
meaning: Highlights the contrast between those seeking improvement and those engaging in unnecessary conflicts.
transliteration: The one with the ailment is seeking a cure, while the healthy one seeks trouble.

text: Ku ñaan ñàkk, boo jëndee am.
meaning: Be self-reliant and do not beg.
transliteration: What you cannot get by begging you can get by buying.

text: Umoya oyiyo uyisityebi.
meaning: Nurturing one's spirit and soul is a form of generosity to oneself.
transliteration: A sound spirit is a good shelter.

text: Alápámálèṣiṣẹ́, baba ọ̀lẹ.
meaning: Strong arms that will not work are lazy arms.
transliteration: A person with sturdy arms but no will to work is the laziest of creatures.

text: Dhalee lakkawuu dadhabee jette kurupheen tokko dhaltee
meaning: the proverb shows pride in something small.
transliteration: The Antelope said, "I cannot count my children," when she only had one child.

text: Wopɛ a, ɛka wo.
meaning: Uncontrolled desire brings suffering.
transliteration:
If you want something too much, it bites you
(i.e you suffer for it).

text: ሎሌ መስሎ ቢሠሩ ጌታ መስሎ ይበሉ፡፡
meaning: Hard work and dedication, even in humble or challenging roles, will ultimately lead to success and reward.
transliteration: If you serve like a slave, you'll dine like a master.

text: No tuggere neeɓiri to ndiyam fuu, nde wartataa linngu
meaning: Some conditions cannot make one change
transliteration: No matter how long a stump stays inside water, it will never be fish

text: Aikin banza, kiwon makahon kare
meaning: Being invested in what cannot profit you.
transliteration: Joblessness, rearing a blind dog

text: Nkịta a na-aṅyụrụ nsị amaghị na ike na-afụ ụfụ
meaning: Whoever that receives help does  not know the suffering behind it
transliteration: The dog that others are releasing faeces does not know that anus can be painful

text: Umcebo awupheli inqobo nje uma kukhona ukuhleba.
meaning: It suggests that there's always talk about wealthy individuals, indicating their continual influence or prominence.
transliteration: Wealth never ends as long as there's a whisper.

text: Ntawe ujya mu ishyamba ngo abure ishyano akurayo
meaning: You are most likely to get harmed when you are exposed to danger
transliteration: None goes in the forest and comes back without any misfortune

text: Mwenye meno makali ndiye mmaliza nyama.
meaning: Those with the necessary skills or attributes are the ones who successfully complete tasks or challenges.
transliteration: The person with sharp teeth is the one who finishes the meat.

text: Lisanza libonga na langi.
meaning: Individuals can reach their full potential when effort is put into refining and improving them.
transliteration: Piece of metal is better when polished.

text: Igangaidza mukwenyi, mhezi yavavira mudumbu.
meaning: Some stressful/ difficult situations leave one at a loss for what to do.
transliteration: It is bewildering for the scratcher, scabies that developed in the stomach.

text: Ninkii aan maqal baan uga sheekaynayaa, meesha maqal baan uga sheekaynayaa.
meaning: It suggests focusing on the receptive audience rather than wasting effort on those who won't listen or understand.
transliteration: I'm telling the one who hasn't heard, not the place that hasn't heard.

text: Bëgg ju sañul feeñe, mook bañaale yem.
meaning: A desire which one cannot manifest is the same as rejection.
transliteration: A love which you lack audacity to show is the same as not loving.

text: Ukufa kwezinja kwenziwa kuzakulula.
meaning: Certain undesirable situations or outcomes may be alleviated or simplified.
transliteration: The death of a dog is made easy.

text: Àgbẹ̀ ló dájà sílẹ̀; ọmọ odó kì í lu ìyá-a rẹ̀ lásán.
meaning: Circumstances often force actions that one would rather avoid.
transliteration: It was the farmer that sowed dissension between them; the pestle would otherwise have no cause to beat the mortar.

text: Lama na hin suufan jette jaartiin qallubbii hattee.
meaning: It means that if you do something and are punished, you will fear doing it again.
transliteration: After stealing the onion, the old woman said "they won't kill me twice".

text: Ɔnantefoɔ hunu amane.
meaning: Life on someone’s land (country) / (town) is not easy.
transliteration: A traveler suffers.

text: እድገታችን እንደ ወላጅ ኩራት እና የአትክልት አበባ አበባ ነው።
meaning: Celebrate your achievements and growth like a parent cherishing their child's success.
transliteration: Our progress is like a parent's pride and a garden's blossoming.

text: Neɗɗo go’oto nyaamataa luumo
meaning: Doing the impossible
transliteration: Neɗɗo go’oto nyaamataa luumo

text: Kanwa ta kashe tsami, kwannafi ya kwanta.
meaning: Finding a solution to a problem.
transliteration: Potash has killed the sourness, the palpitation has gone down

text: Ọjị na-anote aka n’ọnụ ndị maara uru ọ baara
meaning: Onye amaghị uru ihe bara adịghị akpọ ya ihe ọbụla
transliteration: The kolanut lasts longer in the mouth of those who appreciate its value

text: Inja emhlophe ayikhiphi imidlwane emnyama.
meaning: Children often resemble their parents.
transliteration: A white dog does not produce black puppies.

text: Ufite icyo arya arigombaguza
meaning: Someone with more than one choice can get to choose.
transliteration: He/ she who has what to eat hesitates.

text: Mali ya mjomba si ya mpwa.
meaning: One should not rely on the wealth or property of relatives, especially distant ones, and should instead strive for self-sufficiency.
transliteration: The property of the  uncle is not going to the nephew or niece.

text: Eko kota bolingo, kasi mosala eza mokili
meaning: Describes the challenges and obstacles faced in maintaining a loving relationship
transliteration: Il s'accroche à l'amour, mais le chemin est difficile.

text: Kutamba nesanhu, kutemera nyoka ruzhowa.
meaning: It is a waste of time pursuing an endevour that you know will not provide a desirable outcome.
transliteration: It is playing with an axe to construct a branch fence for snakes.

text: Daacadnimada waa laga faa'idaysan karaa.
meaning: Emphasizes the advantages of being truthful.
transliteration: Honesty has its benefits.

text: Guddi am na boroom.
meaning: beware of the night.
transliteration: The night has an owner.

text: Izithelo zomkhonto.
meaning: It refers to the handles or grips of spears, which are essential for wielding them effectively.
transliteration: The handles of spears.

text: Ewúrẹ́ ò wí pé òun ò ṣọre àgùntàn; àgùntàn ló wí pé òun ò ṣọre ewúrẹ́
meaning: The goat would like to associate with the sheep, but the sheep would not associate with the goat; "superior" people reject association with "inferior" people, not the other way round
transliteration: The goat did not say it cannot be friends with the sheep it is the sheep that would not associate with the goat

text: Awaalanii yeroo deebi'an waaqnii isaan hamaruu
meaning: A customary way of wishing someone well upon their return from a funeral, acknowledging the somber experience they've had.
transliteration: When you come back from a funeral, May God bless you.

text: Ɔpanin gye abɔfra nsam akonnwa tena so, na nyɛ asase a ɔte soɔ.
meaning: You can take away a man’s privilege but not his rights.
transliteration: Though an elder may take a stool a child is sitting on, he cannot take the portion of land on which he stays.

text: ከአንድ ሰው ጋር ስላልተስማማሁ አላከብራቸውም ማለት አይደለም።
meaning: Disagreement doesn't preclude respect.
transliteration: Just because I don’t agree with someone doesn’t mean I won’t respect them.

text: Yi’ataa nyiiwa dow hoore muuɗum, maa tennga dow hoore goɗɗo
meaning: To ignore your problem and be concerned about the problem of others
transliteration: You do not see the elephant on your head, but see the louse on some’s head

text: Dare mahutar bawa.
meaning: The body needs rest, always find time to rest.
transliteration: The night is for the slave's rest.

text: Atụrụ ga-epu mpi, ekwo sikwee ya ike
meaning: One will be gorged enough to undertake hard tasks
transliteration: A sheep that wants to develop a hone, let her pelvis be strong

text: Umlando wabantu ungumlando wamazulu.
meaning: Suggests that human history is intertwined with celestial events and natural phenomena.
transliteration: The history of people is the history of the heavens.

text: Nta nzovu ebyiri mu isenga
meaning: Two powerful people do not always get along well. Authority should be granted to one person
transliteration: There are no two elephants in one cave

text: Hakuna mzaha wa shingo.
meaning: The throat is too vulnerable.
transliteration: There is no ridicule of the throat.

text: Moto azali sekele na ngai.
meaning: Ensure access to water
transliteration: A person is my secret.

text: A child who does not listen to elders will be taught by pain.
The river that forgets its source will dry up.
When the drumbeat changes, the dance must change.
Wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one person can embrace it.
The hunter who rushes will miss the path of the antelope.
A single bracelet does not jingle.
The one who asks questions does not lose the way.
Rain does not fall on one roof alone.
However long the night, the dawn will break.
A man who uses force is afraid of reasoning.
The lizard that jumped from the high Iroko tree said he would praise himself if no one else did.
If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
The earth does not get fat.
The mouth that eats does not talk.
The frog in the well does not know the ocean.
The fool speaks, the wise listens.
A tree cannot make a forest.
He who learns, teaches.
One finger cannot lift a pebble.
The wind cannot uproot a mountain.
A bird with borrowed feathers cannot fly far.
The goat that stays near the homestead avoids the leopard.
A lie travels quickly, but the truth catches up.
The stream that makes no noise has the most fish.
When spider webs unite, they can tie up a lion.
The sun will shine on those who stand before it shines on those who kneel.
If the palm-wine tapper is reckless, he will fall from the tree.
The path is made by walking.
It takes a village to raise a child.
The axe forgets; the tree remembers.
If you do not know where you are going, look back to where you came from.
A leopard does not change its spots.
The one who is bitten by a snake fears even a rope.
When the roots are deep, there is no reason to fear the wind.
If you want to hide a fire, hide the smoke.
A patient dog eats the fattest bone.
The tortoise does not rush, yet he arrives with knowledge.
Even the lion needs the fly.
The ear that does not listen to advice is lost.
A person is a person through other persons.
The child who knows his mother will not eat soap.
The chicken that scratches the earth will find food.
The rain that falls on one roof will fall on another.
The canoe does not know who is king.
The moon moves slowly, but it never leaves its path.
He who will eat the kernel must crack the nut.
Even the best dancer on the stage must leave.
The pot that boils does not forget the fire beneath.
A roaring lion kills no game.
The hyena that laughs at others forgets its own tail.
If you climb a good tree, you will be given a push.
The bush that hides the leopard will also hide the hunter.
The day the axe forgets, the tree remembers.
A child’s fingers are not scalded by a piece of hot yam if the mother is near.
A man who cannot dance says the drum is bad.
The bird that eats alone dies alone.
Where water is the boss, the land must obey.
The eye that has seen does not forget.
The flame that burns the grass leaves the earth bare.
A house without people is a house without light.
